trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCanceling"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemCanceling> event when the Cancel button is clicked, but before exiting insert or edit mode.

(A Cancel button is a button whose `CommandName` property is set to "Cancel") This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs, such as stopping the cancel operation if it would put the item in an unwanted state.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs> object is passed to the event-handling method.
This object enables you to determine the index of the item that contains the Cancel button that raised the event.
You can also determine what operation was canceled.
To stop the cancel operation, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial value
The value of the `cancelMode` parameter.
The value of the `itemIndex` parameter.
This constructor is primarily used by control developers when they raise events.
The index of the item that contains the Cancel button that raised the event.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelMode"></xref> values that indicates which operation the user canceled.
Gets the data-entry mode that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control was in when the Cancel button was clicked.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs.CancelMode%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control was in edit or insert mode when the Cancel button was clicked.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelMode"></xref> values.
Gets the index of the item that contains the Cancel button that raised the event.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs.ItemIndex%2A> property to determine the index of the item that contains the Cancel button clicked by the user.

The item index is often used to retrieve the item from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control, which enables you to access the item's properties.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs.CancelMode%2A> property is set to `ListViewCancelMode.CancelingInsert`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewCancelEventArgs.ItemIndex%2A> property is always -1.
The zero-based index of the item that contains the Cancel button that raised the event.
